column4: you can probably just make something like "options.conf" and it will just pick it up automatically.
on the original it's only "options" and it did not work
that's how modprobe.d stuff is supposed to work, anyway... independent configuration files.
I'm not sure about the suffix, but the other files in that directory all end in .conf, so I suggest yours do as well.
there is some sensitivity to the exact name because old files are left around with names like foo.conf.dpkg-old and it's undesirable that they get executed.

also, as an emergency workaround you should be able to rmmod the module and then modprobe it with the right option so you can always get past this problem even if passing the option automatically didn't work right now...
